moduleMetadataJson.name: SSH Username Enumeration
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module uses a malformed packet or timing attack to enumerate users on
        an OpenSSH server.

        The default action sends a malformed (corrupted) SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_REQUEST
        packet using public key authentication (must be enabled) to enumerate users.

        On some versions of OpenSSH under some configurations, OpenSSH will return a
        "permission denied" error for an invalid user faster than for a valid user,
        creating an opportunity for a timing attack to enumerate users.

        Testing note: invalid users were logged, while valid users were not. YMMV.
author: kenkeiras
Dariusz Tytko
Michal Sajdak
Qualys
wvu <wvu@metasploit.com>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: SSH_TIMEOUT
options.description: Specify the maximum time to negotiate a SSH session

options.name: THREADS
options.description: The number of concurrent threads (max one per host)

options.name: ShowProgress
options.description: Display progress messages during a scan

options.name: ShowProgressPercent
options.description: The interval in percent that progress should be shown

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: USER_FILE
options.description: File containing usernames, one per line

options.name: THRESHOLD
options.description: Amount of seconds needed before a user is considered found (timing attack only)

options.name: RETRY_NUM
options.description: The number of attempts to connect to a SSH server for each user
